messages: 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (12:40): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: thanks
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:45): Hmm, </br clear=left> is like <br clear=left> in Opera, but like <br> in IE (and is ignored in FF/Safari)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (12:49): (try quirks mode for fx/saf)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:51): Ah - FF2-quirks does it like <br>, Safari-quirks still ignores it
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:51): and O9.5 does it like <br>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:51): and HTML5 does that too?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (12:52): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: yeah
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:52): good good
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:52): "An end tag whose tag name is "br"   Parse error. Act as if a start tag token with the tag name "br" had been seen. Ignore the end tag token."
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:52): I guess it's implicit that the generated token has no attributes
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (12:52): that's how i read it anyway
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (12:53): since the attributes are attached to the token that is ignored
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:53): A start tag token corresponding to <br foo=bar> satisfies the explicit condition of being a start tag token with the tag name "br"
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (12:55): the spec has lots of "act as if a start tag token with...", but it could be clarified that such tokens have no attributes
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:55): Might just be a waste of time, though
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:55): looks like the Opera 9.5 approach to MathML can't deal with http://golem.ph.utexas.edu/~distler/blog/archives/001594.html
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:55): if it's not said explicitly that it has attributes it should've none
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:55): that's how specs work
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:56): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: Is it specified anywhere that that's how specs work?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:56): do both v.nu and html5lib do the right thing already with the current spec wording?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:56): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, I'm not sure how explicit it is that doing something that the specification does not explicitly forbid is non-conforming
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:57): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, but it's pretty much agreed upon that inserting random attributes during full moon is wrong
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:57): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: speccing how specs work reminds me of "entity-escaped HTML in RSS <title>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:57): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, I think html5lib does </br> correctly
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:58): not sure how many tests we have for that though

What if there are occurrences of the header in the trailer of a chunked response?
